page.title: 08SERVICES IN DENTON
page.content: Denton had{electricity}earlier than surrounding villages as Denton House was a large Army convalescent home during the 2nd World War;it was wired for them and later extended to the village.All homes have {mains water} laid in 1955.Half have mains drainage, half septic tanks.All properties have fixed bath and toilet.There is no mains gas supply,some use bottled gas for cooking & heating.There is a refuse collection weekly.There is only 1 {shop,}stocking a wide range of goods from groceries to petfood,hard- ware to fancy goods,stationery to freezer supplies.It incorporates a sub-postoffice for pensions,allowances and Giro-Bank. For telephone & post-"Communications". For domiciliary services,Police & Fire Services -"Health & Welfare".
